Event.description: 10 Players
Event.name: Blood Bowl Tournament

Event.description: Games: the final frontier. These are the tales of five college students. Their continuing mission: to explore strange new titles, to seek out new genres and new platforms, to boldly go where no one has gone before. -- Panelists: In this episode, the young developers are challenged to learn the black art of making a game in over eleven weeks at MassDiGI’s Summer Innovation Program. Hear them tell the story of how they met their goals and, in the process, overcame giant bugs, terrifying teamwork, wicked technical problems, diabolical daily builds, stale pizza and zombies.
Event.name: Game Devs: The Next Generation

Event.description: Ever wanted to gain insight into the minds of League of Legends content creators? The time it takes to write a parody or original song, the struggles of LoLReplay, and the challenge of collaborating to bring the community entertaining content? Well here is your chance, everyone! Join League YouTubers PlayerPOV Cody, Natsumiii, LilyPichu, Keyori and blakinola on an insightful and entertaining League of Legends-themed panel! You’ll learn background stories and gain insight on what it takes to keep the masses entertained in the ever-expanding League of Legends universe. From commentary to voice acting, they’ve got you covered. Get questions prepared, because they’re ready for you! -- Panelists: blakinola, PlayerPOV Cody, Natsumiii, LilyPichu, Keyori
Event.name: League of Legends YouTuber Panel: How League Becomes Your Entertainment

Event.description: 500 Points, 10 Players
Event.name: Warhammer 40,000 - Combat Patrol Tournament

Event.description: Join us for the best WARMACHINE and HORDES casual play miniatures gaming event at PAX! Starting at 10am Friday, simply come to the Iron Arena registration table any time the event is open to sign up. Once you’re signed in, find opponents (we’ll have an area where people looking for other players can meet up) and play games on any open tables. You and your opponent decide the size and specifics of the game. Once the game is done, both players should come to the Iron Arena registration table to report the game results to earn Skulls for achievements - both players earn Skulls, not just the winner. Then you go find new opponents and play more games. Play as much or as little as you like. We keep track of the Skulls you earn (they roll over from day to day until 3pm Sunday) and you can spend them at any time for items from our amazing prize pool.
Event.name: Warmachine/Hordes - Iron Arena Friday Tournament

Event.description: The first of two events this weekend to qualify for the Masters Tournament on Sunday, this is a 35-point WARMACHINE and HORDES Steamroller tournament that will use the Steamroller 2014 tournament pack. We will use the death clock timing variant and cap the event length at a maximum of 4 rounds to make sure that rounds move quickly and we don’t run too long. This is a single-list event (bring just one 35-point army) but will use the Specialists artifice to allow you to bring 10 points of specialists to swap into your force before each game. See the Steamroller rules pack for more details. Check-in for the tournament begins at 10am, games will begin promptly at 11am. Top four players are qualified for the Masters Tournament on Sunday. Full rules can be found at: http://files.privateerpress.com/op/sr2014/Steamroller2014Print.pdf
Event.name: Warmachine/Hordes - Special Forces Tournament

Event.description: Kerrigan, Diablo, and Arthas walk into a bar and…end up in the same game? Blizzard’s new team brawler challenges longstanding conventions of the genre with multiple maps, unique objectives, and heroes that play quite differently than you might expect. Come watch a showmatch, see Blizzard developers reveal some new heroes, and ask questions! -- Panelists: Kaeo Milker [Senior Bossman, Blizzard], Dustin Browder [Rocks and Boulders Expert, Blizzard], Phill Gonzales [Picture Tracer and Scrapbooker, Blizzard]
Event.name: Heroes of the Storm - The Ultimate Blizzard Mashup

Event.description: Do you have a great boardgame design, want to make it yourself, but have no idea how to start? Join us as we take you through the trials, tribulations, and triumphs of independent tabletop game publishing. Thomas Eliot of Sixpence Games designed, Kickstarted, manufactured, and brought to retail Professor Pugnacious, and was on the Indie Boardgame Panel at PAX AUS 2014, while Christopher Batarlis just recently finished the Kickstarter for Secrets of the Lost Tomb. Learn from our experience, good decisions, and mistakes. Plus, see the launch of Sixpence Games’ newest Kickstarter, Cultists of Cthulhu, live during the panel! -- Panelists: Thomas Eliot [Game Designer, Sixpence Games], Christopher Batarlis [Game Designer, Everything Epic Games]
Event.name: Indie Boardgames: Design and Crowdfunding

Event.description: We’re pleased to present the opening session of PAX East 2014, Storytime with Alex Rigopulos! As the CEO and Co-Founder of Harmonix, Alex has been… instrumental… in creating cult classics such as Frequency and Amplitude to the modern day staples of Rock Band and Dance Central, so we can’t wait to hear what stories he’ll have to share!
Event.name: Storytime with Alex Rigopulos

Event.description: Martin Rae, president, Academy of Interactive Arts & Sciences, will be bringing to the PAX East stage 2014 D.I.C.E. (Design, Innovate, Communicate, Entertain) Summit speaker, Rami Ismail. Rami, who is the business and development guy at Vlambeer, will reprise his talk titled: “No holding back: A look at independent game development during three years of Vlambeer.” Rami discusses The Golden Age for independent development, running through the last five years as he learned of the independent gaming scene. He will discuss lessons learned and applicable to an ever-changing scene, the importance of technological democratization and the shift in the relation between developers, platforms, consumers and partners. Following the talk will be an audience Q&A with Rami. -- Panelists: Martin Rae [Academy of Interactive Arts & Sciences, President], Rami Ismail [Vlambeer, Chief Executive Business & Development]
Event.name: Best of the 2014 D.I.C.E. Summit

Event.description: Heats at 11:00, 12:30, 2:00, 3:30; Semifinals 5:00; Finals 6:00. 16 players per heat.
Event.name: Dominion Friday Tournament

Event.description: 64 4-Way FFA, Room A
Event.name: Geometry Wars 2 Tournament

Event.description: 100 point fleets. Promotional prizes given to participants. Hosted by Fantasy Flight Games.
Event.name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Tournament

Event.description: Are you a writer? Want to be? Get creative with Tonic. -- Panelists: Videogame and story consultants and Tonic Industries co-founders Hilary Heskett Shapiro and Miellyn Fitzwater Barrows lead a dynamic writer’s workshop with tips and tricks for brainstorming, breaking through the writer’s block, staying focused, finding the right critique group, learning the rules, promoting your work, and getting creative, now. So bring your notes and join us for an interactive chat about building worlds and telling a really great story.
Event.name: Writer’s Workshop with Tonic Industries

Event.description: Join the AppJunkies as they arm themselves with an entirely new lineup of horrible app disasters. Prepare to be amazed (and slightly stunned) by their display of insane feats of attempted app creation. Like taking a vacation to an island full of misfit games and crushed dreams, it’s an hour of your life you won’t get back… but you’ll be happy you spent it laughing at our misfortune. Stop in for prizes and laughs as the AppJunkies and guests highlight the best of the worst straight from the seedy side of the app store. -- Panelists: Seven DeBord [Founder, IndieHangover / AppJunkies], Jacob Wood [EIC, IndieHangover / AppJunkies], Patrick Mulhern [EIC, Lorehound], Dru Staltman [Developer, Bootsnake Games], Mat Staltman [Developer, Bootsnake Games]
Event.name: AppJunkies Live: The Worst Apps Ever Made!

Event.description: Lead the forces of a kingdom in sweeping battle across the entire face of the Iron Kingdoms in this new deck building strategy card game from Privateer Press. This tournament will be a one-on-one format with the top two players qualifying for the championship tournament on Sunday morning. Space is limited to 16 players so sign up early to secure your spot. Check-in begins at 11:30am with games starting at high noon. Bring your cards and your friendly competitive spirit. Rules for the Kingmaker format can be found at http://privateerpress.com/high-command/organized-play/kingmaker and if you want to learn more about High Command, check out http://privateerpress.com/high-command
Event.name: High Command - Kingmaker Tournament

Event.description: Heats at 11:30, 1:30; Semifinals 3:30; Finals 5:30. 20 players per heat.
Event.name: Ticket to Ride Tournament

Event.description: Do you like video games? Do you like cool stories? Want to hear about what it’s like to work for one of the biggest gaming websites on the planet? Come hang out with the staff of Kotaku as we regale you with fun stories about the world of gaming, PAX, and the video games we love (and hate) most. There’ll be plenty of time for questions, too, so bring your toughest. -- Panelists: Jason Schreier [Kotaku], Tina Amini [Kotaku], Evan Narcisse [Kotaku], Steve Marinconz [Kotaku], Chris Person [Kotaku]
Event.name: Kotaku’s Incredible Fantastic Panel Extravaganza XVIII-2

Event.description: The indie games focus is on how anyone can make games yet, just like in “AAA”, there’s still a dearth of many voices; most personal to me being the lack of those representing of cultures I grew up in, that of urban black and Latino communities. Black and Latino people have created many forms of our national and worldwide culture and are a rather large part of the games consumer base yet are the tiniest percent of games creators and you have to wonder why. Is it technology, societal mores, apathy, lack of notable and relatable success stories or other reasons that have created a barrier to seeing notable growth from these groups? -- Panelists: This talk will be an exploration of those possibilities and more, as well as speaking to how and why it’s important that indies and surrounding establishments, such as games media, academia and cultural conference organizers can help turn the tide and create a truly more inclusive indie games scene.
Event.name: How Urban Black and Latino Culture Can be the Next Frontier in Games

Event.description: Your first attempt at game development will be messy, unpredictable and hilarious. These pro developers know firsthand! Back for its second year, the First Game Ever project features a new panel of brave souls ready to bare all. They’ll give live demos of the games that got them started and share their lessons learned, highlighting the advice they wish they could give to their younger self. The panel will wrap up with exclusive video interviews from gaming legends like Will Wright, Bob Bates and more! Panelists will be hilarious, informative, and mostly clothed. We promise. -- Panelists: David Bisceglia [CEO/Co-Founder, The Tap Lab], Zoe Quinn [Game Developer, Zoe Quinn], Rami Ismail [Business & Development Guy, Vlambeer], Eitan Glinert [President, Fire Hose Games], Matt Boch [Creative Director, Harmonix]
Event.name: I’ll Show You Mine If You Show Me Yours, Again!

Event.description: 20 players; top 2 per table advance each round. Expansions added as rounds progress.
Event.name: Race For the Galaxy Tournament

Event.description: Join Rooster Teeth in their regularly scheduled program as they drunkenly swear at each other and occasionally at the audience. These guys do this for a living? What jerks! You should go visit them in their booth (#342) and give them a piece of your mind!
Event.name: Rooster Teeth

Event.description: The immortal hobby of PC gaming continues to experience a renaissance of innovation, affordability, and accessibility. Free-to-play, an explosive indie scene, eSports, virtual reality, livestreaming, 4K displays, crowdfunding, Steam Early Access, and the growth of Linux position the PC as a truly vibrant platform. -- Panelists: Evan Lahti [Editor-in-Chief, PC Gamer], Palmer Luckey [Founder, Oculus VR], John Smedley [President, Sony Online Entertainment], Tom Petersen [Director of Technical Marketing, Nvidia], Chris Roberts [Founder, Imperium Games]
Event.name: The (Incredible) Future of PC Gaming, Hosted by PC Gamer

Event.description: 64 Player 1v1, Room B
Event.name: Ultimate Marvel vs. Capcom 3 Tournament

Event.description: Rock out to the chip sounds of, Sam Mulligan, Rekcahdam, Bright Primate, and Professor Shyguy
Event.name: Boston 8-Bit Presents: PAX 2014 Chiptune Showcase Part 1

Event.description: Come meet Mike Krahulik and Jerry Holkins, the creators of Penny Arcade, for an autograph session. They will be signing stuff and talking about stuff. Lots of stuff happening over here. -- Panelists: Mike Krahulik, Jerry Holkins
Event.name: Autograph Session: Gabe and Tycho Part 1

Event.description: If you know just three people, according to recent studies, one of you is currently dealing with an emotional ailment. So why is it still so hard to talk about? The stigma of mental illness is real and creates real danger. -- Panelists: Take This was founded in 2012 after the tragic suicide of a member of our community who believed he was alone. Take This provides awareness, education and empathy for those suffering from emotional distress, their families or greater institutions. We have found that most emotional ailments, if left untreated, can deteriorate, and that the easiest route to getting help is connecting with others.
Event.name: Take This - “But I’m Not Crazy”

Event.description: Some have a pride of lions. Others have a murder of crows. We’ve got a Tyranny of Dragons. Join “DM to the Stars” Chris Perkins as he weaves a tale of cultists, evil dragons, and the return of their dark queen - Tiamat. Be one of the first to learn of the story and see art for the Tyranny of Dragons campaign and the new edition of Dungeons & Dragons! -- Panelists: Chris Perkins [Senior Worldbuilding Designer, Wizards of the Coast]
Event.name: Dungeons & Dragons Preview - Tyranny of Dragons featuring Chris Perkins

Event.description: 12 players; top placement(s) advance each round.
Event.name: Galaxy Trucker Tournament

Event.description: 32 Player 1v1, Room B
Event.name: Super Puzzle Fighter Tournament

Event.description: In gaming forums around the world, variations of the same thread forever grace the front page: “Looking for a Gaming Group.” Games are ubiquitous, barriers to entry are ever-lower, and the Internet (never mind conventions like PAX) provide what should be a sea of gamers ready and willing to play games with us. So why all the trouble? Why, in 2014, is it still so hard to form a gaming group? Why won’t anyone play Air Hockey with me? -- Panelists: In exploring the “LFG” space, there are a myriad of issues which come to light. Skill gaps leave players stranded. Matchmaking systems hurt as much as they help. The longer tail of games available spreads niche audiences further into increasingly specific sub-sub-sub-genres. Play styles differ. (Indeed, in some groups it is impolite to spend more than ten seconds on one’s turn, while in others spending less than ten MINUTES is the height of rudeness)!
Event.name: Why No One Will Game with You

Event.description: Think you’ve got what it takes to create the next Catan? Want to trade in your day job to become a full time game master? This panel will share the ins and outs of game design - creating game concepts, commissioning artwork, fundraising, manufacturing, distribution, and more. -- Panelists: Learn from experts who have developed new titles, completed six and seven-figure Kickstarter campaigns, and brought amazing new games into the world.
Event.name: From Playtest to 3-D Printer: How to Make, Fund, and Sell Your Own Boardgame

Event.description: The Dawngate designers discuss their trials, tribulations, and efforts to make a new MOBA that does things differently. -- Panelists: Dave Cerra [Lead Producer, Dawngate], Alex Hetu [Lead Systems Designer, Dawngate], Daniel Gibson [Lead Character Designer, Dawngate], Hunter Howe [Creative Director, Dawngate]
Event.name: Is MOBA a Genre? The Design of Dawngate

Event.description: Even as the quality of many sports video games has peaked, one fact is undeniable - today, there are far fewer options available to play. Fans used to have several baseball, football, basketball, hockey, and soccer choices each year. Nowadays, they’re lucky to even have one per sport! Join the panelists of the popular Press Row Podcast (featuring the sports game writers from Polygon, Joystiq, GamesRadar, US Gamer, and ThatSportsGamer) as they debate whether it is the beginning of the end for big-time sports games or the start of a transformation to an entirely different model. -- Panelists: Richard Grisham [Writer, Podcaster, GamesRadar], Samit Sarkar [Reporter, Polygon], Owen Good [Reporter, Polygon], Kat Bailey [Writer, US Gamer], TJ Lauerman [Writer, ThatSportsGamer]
Event.name: The Sports Video Game Crisis

Event.description: 64 4-Way FFA, Room B
Event.name: Halo 4 Tournament

Event.description: Want to get your foot in the door at a gaming company? Join industry employees as they share experiences, stories, and advice about landing their jobs. Game careers aren’t all just programming and design - marketers,event coordinators, community managers, mixologists and many others make up the gaming industry. There are tons of career options, and even more ways to wind up in the industry, but one thing’s for sure: if you want to know what it takes then you don’t want to miss this panel! -- Panelists: Justin Korthof [Community Manager, Robot Entertainment], Mitch Hutts [Creator and Manager, The Drunken Moogle], Pang [VP / Creative Director, Frogdice Studio], Michael Hartman [CEO, Frogdice Studio], Matt “Canj” Cangialosi [Marketing / Community Manager, Indie Game Stand], Mike Gnade [Owner / Business Development, Indie Game Stand], Andy Lunique [Former Ubisoft Brand Ambassador], Dan Higgins [Owner / Lead Programmer, Lunchtime Studios], Alix Stolzer [PR / Dev, Robot Loves Kitty], Richie Hoagland [Creative Director, Super Soul]
Event.name: Land My Job! Inside Advice on Getting into the Game Industry

Event.description: Half a year has passed since the respective launches of the Xbox One and PS4, but it’s yet to be clear what exactly is going to be the dominant force in this new age of next-gen tech. Who is poised to be the victor in the next stage of the console war—Microsoft? Sony? Nintendo? Ouya? Valve with their SteamBox? Join this panel of industry experts as they talk about the successes - and the shortcomings - of this next, err, the PRESENT generation of gaming consoles. -- Panelists: Paul Goodman [Video Editor, The Escapist], Chris Kohler [Editor, Wired], Mike Futter [News Editor, Game Informer], Alexander Silwinski [News Content Director, Joystiq]
Event.name: Six Months Into the New Console War

Event.description: Join host Michael Robles and panelists Tifa Robles, Marc Watson (Mojang), Cherisse Watson (Lyft), Russ Pitts (Polygon) and Susan Arendt (Joystiq) as they discuss being a couple that games together and solving gamer couple problems. -- Panelists: Michael Robles [Community Manager, Microsoft], Tifa Robles [Founder/Organizer, Lady Planeswalker Society], Marc Watson [Customer Service Manager, Mojang], Cherisse Watson [Organizer, Queer Geek! Magic Night], Russ Pitts [Features Editor, Polygon], Susan Arendt [Managing Editor, Joystiq]
Event.name: The Couple That Games Together…

Event.description: WildStar’s launch is getting closer! This year’s highly-anticipated MMO is just about ready for liftoff, and we want you to be a part of it! We’ve got it all: Action combat, the most customizable housing system you’ve ever seen, crazy 40-man raids, and much, much more. Join the Carbine team as they answer questions, reveal the new hotness, and make fun of Chad’s PvP skills. Bring your “A” game, and get ready for an hour of fun, chaos, and terrible jokes. -- Panelists: Jeremy Gaffney, Stephan Frost, Chad Moore, Joe Piepiora, Jen Gordy
Event.name: WildStar: $#!& Just Got Real

Event.description: At Riot Games, no day goes by that we’re not blown away by the actions and interactions of the League of Legends community. From collegiate clubs to cosplayers, from streamers to artists, from fan sites to tournament organizers, the community’s taken the stage to expand and redefine the League of Legends experience for everyone. In this panel, we’ll discuss how we challenge the conventions of traditional PR and Community disciplines to build a different kind of relationship with players. -- Panelists: Ilja Rotelli [Community, Riot], Adam Shetler [Social Media, Riot], T. Carl Kwoh [Production, Riot], Christopher Tom [Player Relations, Riot]
Event.name: Connecting and Supporting the League of Legends Community

Event.description: This is the panel for people who have caught themselves saying things like, “You should’ve seen the headshot my 12-year-old made last night” or maybe “Hey kid, can you show me your new Shaman rotation? That DPS was cray!”. When we talk about “next gen”, we mean our kids. Our panel of expert parents look at raising ‘em right in a gaming family. -- Panelists: Kristin Lindsay [Penny Arcade], Eric Neustadler [Microsoft], Jeff Kalles [Penny Arcade]
Event.name: Junior Has Joined Your Party!

Event.description: Join Minecrafter experts CaptainSparklez, TheBajanCanadian, and some surprise special guests in this highly entertaining and interactive panel about everyone’s favorite online block-building game! -- Panelists: CaptainParklez, TheBajanCanadian
Event.name: Polaris Presents: Minecraft Superblock

Event.description: 64 Player 4-Way FFA, Room A
Event.name: Towerfall Ascension Tournament

Event.description: The past 20 years have been a roller-coaster ride for RPGs. The release of Magic: The Gathering in 1993 changed the fundamental nature of the hobby gaming industry and forever altered the business of making and selling RPGs. Explore the recent history of the category through the lens of Dungeons & Dragons and Pathfinder, and hear predictions for the future of the hobby. -- Panelists: Ryan Dancey [CEO, Goblinworks], Luke Peterschmidt [CEO, Fun to 11], Derek Lloyd [Owner, Battleground Games and Hobbies], Luke Crane [Tabletop Games Specialist, Kickstarter], Matt McElroy [Marketing Director, DriveThruRPG/OneBookshelf]
Event.name: What Is Happening to Tabletop Roleplaying Games?

Event.description: Can’t get enough music at PAX? The MAGFest jamspace hosts chiptunes, bands, and open mic jamming all weekend! This Jamspace concert will bring you the sounds of Shin Sekai Cover Project, and The World is Square.
Event.name: Jamspace Concert

Event.description: Once we’ve selected the mystery Omeganauts (IT COULD BE YOU), it’s onward to the competition! We painstakingly spent 15 months constructing a giant sized Perfection board with foam pieces over 6 feet in height for the opening round. Unfortunately, due to a shipping error, the board was sent to the PAX Australia address, where it is currently collecting spiders and kangaroos. But that’s okay! We brought the home version as a backup! 32 teams will enter, but only 16 will leave.
Event.name: Omegathon Round 1 - Perfection

Event.description: Social Media is a noisy world for brands and individuals alike. Whether it’s Twitter or YouTube, Facebook or Google+, there’s a whole world out there waiting for your brand, website, or thoughts. Join folks that work behind the scenes for Activision, Deep Silver, Gunnar Optiks, Harmonix, Sprint, and Ubisoft for a conversation on how to build and manage your brand, work with customers, balance personal accounts in the public eye, and avoid the pitfalls in the hectic social media sphere. -- Panelists: Dan Amrich [Community Developer, Ubisoft], Aubrey Norris [Director of Marketing & PR, Deep Silver], John Drake [Director of Publishing and PR, Harmonix], Dan Hevia [Editor-in-Chief, Project 510], Dave Oshry [Director of Marketing Strategy, Gunnar Optiks], Andrien Gbinigie [Community Developer - Assassin’s Creed Initiates, Ubisoft], Jake Baldino [Internet Video Personality, Pretty Much It]
Event.name: The Audacity of #Hype: The Do’s, Dont’s & WTF’s of Modern Social Media

Event.description: The Internet is full of empowering tools, but who are we empowering? It feels like the most toxic voices have strangled our ability to have a conversation, and we’re now used to a world where death threats and harassment are both expected and tolerated. Giant Bomb news editor Patrick Klepek has reported and commented on the industry while dealing with major life traumas, including the death of his father and colleague Ryan Davis. Designer Zoe Quinn experienced waves of abuse—both on and off the Internet—while trying to get Depression Quest on Steam. Their experiences have given them much to ponder about how we digitally conduct ourselves. Both will present stories of the personal impact these moments had, and what we can do about them. -- Panelists: Patrick Klepek [News Editor, Giant Bomb], Zoe Quinn [Game Designer]
Event.name: Why Internet Jerks Aren’t Going to Win, And You Can Help

Event.description: Everyone loves a great Kickstarter, yet nearly half of all music campaigns are unsuccessful. Gamer culture continues to influence the indie music scene in increasingly mainstream ways. Hear from some of the artists rooted in the video game and gamer/geek-culture music scene on how they managed to collectively raise nearly $350,000 in funds for their projects. Additionally you’ll hear insight on building your audience in the niche world of gamer-culture in addition to some general insight in “a day in the life of” artists like Big Giant Circles (Impostor Nostalgia, The Glory Days) zircon (Identity Sequence, Final Fantasy 6: Balance and Ruin), Jillian Aversa (Atlantis Awakening) and The Doubleclicks (Dimetrodon, Lasers and Feelings, “Nothing to Prove”). -- Panelists: Jimmy Hinson [Composer, Big Giant Circles], Andrew Aversa [Composer, zircon], Jillian Aversa [Songwriter / Performer], Angela Webber [Songwriter / Performer, The Doubleclicks], Aubrey Webber [Songwriter / Performer, The Doubleclicks], Kelsey Ehrlich [Charisma +2 / Desert Bus for Hope]
Event.name: You’re a Gamer and a Musician. How Can Crowdfunding Work for You?

Event.description: Come check out TheBajanCanadian, CaptainSparklez, and AshleyMarieeGaming in the Queue Hall Autographing Area after their Minecraft Superbock! Panel. -- Panelists: TheBajanCanadian, CaptainSparklez, AshleyMarieeGaming
Event.name: Autograph Session: Polaris Minecraft Superblock!

Event.description: Chances are high that if you’ve spent more than five minutes on the Internet you’ve witnessed a perfectly normal conversation devolve into a flame war. This is a particularly common problem in game culture, where emotions run hot and high due to “friendly” competition. But when do name-calling and empty threats turn into criminal activities? During this lecture we’ll take an analytical approach to cyber-bullying, cyber-stalking, and harassment, breaking down the laws and regulations that have evolved around this peculiar problem that is aggravated by the illusion of anonymity. Through this discussion you will acquire the legal tools you need to protect yourself if you’ve become a victim of cyber-bullying, and you’ll also pick up a few pointers so you know when you’ve crossed the legal line. -- Panelists: Mona Ibrahim [Video Game Attorney, MAI Entertainment Law]
Event.name: Terrifying Adventures in Cyberland: A Legal Toolkit for Bullying, Stalking and Harassment in Game Cu

Event.description: Penny Arcade’s Mike Krahulik, designer of the upcoming RPG Thornwatch, and Lone Shark Games’s Mike Selinker, designer of the highly popular Pathfinder Adventure Card Game, talk about how they made their RPG-like games out of cards. It’s probably “because of reasons,” but show up and find out. -- Panelists: Mike Selinker [President, Lone Shark Games], Mike ‘Gabe’ Krahulik [Penny Arcade]
Event.name: The Mike & Mike Show: Why Are There Cards in My RPG?

Event.description: 32 Player 1v1, Room A
Event.name: Burnout Crash! Tournament

Event.description: Every year, the NVIDIA PAX Power Panel delivers the latest, greatest insight into the hottest gaming products and technologies.
Event.name: NVIDIA. The Way It’s Meant to be Played

Event.description: You’ve got 45 seconds to deliver your idea to our panel of experts. The top three pitches will be picked for prizes and swag! (Please note that this is an open forum - there’s nothing keeping anyone, judges and attendees alike, from stealing your ideas! If you’re not comfortable with this, please don’t pitch your idea!)
Event.name: Pitch Your Game Idea

Event.description: Join us for a live game show that asks and answers questions about being transgender and involved in gaming. Using a format similar to Cards Against Humanity, our panelists will find fun answers then poll the audience as to which answers seem right or wrong, and why. Audience members can pose their own questions or try their hand at providing an answer for a unique Q&A. -- Panelists: Charles Battersby [Founder, Theater For Nerds], Eric L. Patterson [Executive Editor, EGM Media], Rebecca Heineman [Founder, Olde Skuul], Chloe Sagal [Developer, Indie Developer], Jennell Jaquays [Chief Creative Officer, Olde Skuul], Lexi Leigh Richardson [Gaming Hobbyist and journalist]
Event.name: Press XY Presents: Trans Against Insanity

Event.description: Consumers of games and producers of games unite! A love of gaming initiates a trajectory of learning that can be extremely personally rewarding. As game players, we learn deep insights about game mechanics and our personal sense of fun by engaging different game types. But the opportunity goes much deeper, and games have become a conduit to learning how to code and produce physical gaming interactions through product development. Get involved in this panel… -- Panelists: Devon Loffreto [Developer, kidOYO.com/FredxCoders.com], Melora Loffreto [Product Developer, kidOYO.com/FredxCoders.com], Elliott Sperlazza [Developer, RedHat/FredxCoders.com], Joel Peck [Developer, UMW/FredxCoders.com], Brandon Feldkamp [Developer, RedHat/FredxCoders.com]
Event.name: Kids Learn to Code and Make with Games

Event.description: Live On Three celebrates its 5th year as the first live esports show of its kind without the fluff. Commemorating the best moments of the show in the last five years, coinciding with the most important, influential, interesting, and outright hilarious moments in esports and competitive gaming over that same timespan. With your hosts Marcus “djWHEAT” Graham, Rod “Slasher” Breslau, and Scott “SirScoots” Smith -- Panelists: Marcus Graham [Senior Manager of Partnerships, TwitchTV], Rod Breslau [Senior Editor, Gamers.com], Scott Smith
Event.name: Live On Three: The Last 5 years in eSports and Competitive Gaming

Event.description: 32 Player 2v2, Room B
Event.name: Mario Kart: Double Dash Tournament

Event.description: Join us for a history of Roguelikes from Rogue (1980) to Spelunky (2009-2014), including NetHack, FTL and other great games! We’ll take a look at the recent resurgence of Roguelikes, discuss our history with the genre, and you’ll get a chance to see just how embarrassingly bad we can be at a speedrun or three. -- Panelists: Eric Neustadter [Gaming Ninja, Xbox], Dan Amrich [Community Developer, Ubisoft], Jeff Green [Chief Consultant, Hit Detection]
Event.name: Three Old Guys Play Roguelikes

Event.description: Worker placement, king making, traitor mechanics, semi-co-op. Learn what it takes to talk like a board game geek. Thinking about starting a blog, a podcast, a web show? Join your fellow board game geeks as we analyze board game media and language. You’ve got to learn the lingo if you want to improve the industry (and trash talk your friends). Let’s talk board games. -- Panelists: Mackenzie Cameron [Creator, Going OverBoard: The Board Game Webcomic], Samuel Liberty [Founder, Spoiled Flush Games], Ben Marshalkowski [Blogger, Board Game Ben], Rhiannon Oches [Blogger, Spooning Meeples], Erin Ryan [Senior Writer, Cardboard Republic], Kevin Spak [Spoiled Flush Games]
Event.name: Talk like a Board Game Geek

Event.description: Join Square Enix and developer Airtight Games for an interactive look at Murdered: Soul Suspect, a dark, detective thriller with a supernatural twist: solving your own murder from the afterlife. The first 500 attendees will receive a PAX East 2014 exclusive Murdered Soul Suspect t-shirt -- Panelists: Matt Brunner [Chief Media Officer], Dennis Price [Art Director], Nagato Sugiyama [Executive Producer], Mark Safarik [M.S. V.S.M. FBI Profiler (Ret.) Host of Killer Instinct]
Event.name: Square Enix Presents Murdered: Soul Suspect

Event.description: We’re back! Last year went so well we want to run this panel again. Lindsay Aries of Leeleethebunny Cosplay, and Alyssa and Reith of Propped Up Creations team up to demonstrate the basics of molding and casting. This science has become really popular in replica building and costuming lately so we’re combining our knowledge into this panel. We will have fantastic Martha Stewart style demonstrations to show throughout the process and none of us are afraid of questions for those looking to start a project. -- Panelists: Lindsay Aries [Special Effects Costumer, Leeleethebunny Cosplay], Alyssa Smith [Special Effects Costumer, Propped Up Creations], Reith Poppo [Special Effects Costumer, Propped Up Creations]
Event.name: Molding and Casting for Beginners

Event.description: 32 players; each player receives 7 booster packs to build a deck and compete in 5 swiss rounds. Prizes based on record. $24 entry fee. Hosted by Pandemonium Games.
Event.name: My Little Pony CCG - Sealed Deck Tournament

Event.description: If a weapon is too powerful you bring down its damage. If a character class is too powerful you nerf some abilities. But how do you balance a game that is strictly words? Our panelists talk about their experiences balancing tabletop card game hit These French Fries Are Terrible Hot Dogs, Gamebook adventure series Strange Loves and comedic arguing game Let’s Quip. Watch as the panelists get into the semantics of words and their perceived power. -- Panelists: Sean Baptiste [Minister of Propaganda, Fire Hose Games], Shawn Pierre [Developer/Owner, OriGaminc], Miellyn Fitzwater Barrows [Owner/Creative Director, Gorgeous Robot], Sharat Bhat [Senior Programmer, Fire Hose Games], Max Temkin [Founder, Cards Against Humanity LLC]
Event.name: Wordscapin’ - How the Hell Do You Balance a Word Game?

Event.description: 32 Player 1v1, Room A
Event.name: Tetris Attack Tournament

Event.description: How does Kickstarter actually work. Why is the industry’s relationship with women? Is Early access awesome or annoying? Is Free 2 Play sliced bread or raw dough? These questions and more are answered by this wise, infallible members of our esteemed panel, or alternatively horribly bungled to comedic effect. Join the cast of weekly podcast The Gamers With Jobs Conference Call and Ken Levine (Irrational Games) as they deliver the wisdom of the ages. Or yell at each other a lot while the audience heckles. -- Panelists: Shawn Andrich [Co-Founder, Gamers With Jobs], Sean Sands [Co-Founder, Gamers With Jobs], Julian Murdoch [Writer, Gamers With Jobs], Cory Banks [Managing Editor, PC Gamer], Ken Levine [Creative Director and Co-founder, Irrational Games], Elena Siegman [Lead Developer, Irrational Games]
Event.name: Gamers With Jobs Saves Gaming

Event.description: 50 players; winning team in each game will be advanced and re-shuffled until only one group remains victorious!
Event.name: The Resistance Tournament

Event.description: Ever since Parappa the Rapper told you to punch and kick, Rhythm Games have been awesome. But dance dance revolutionaries grooving on giant buttons know something that Ulala never reported on: playing rhythm games is following a script. Other video games have decisions and tradeoffs-is playing with music merely pressing when told? This panel of designers pioneering new music gameplay would argue no! Players can conduct music with gestures. Players can control the game with rhythm. Players can generate levels from their own music. Rad! Join designers behind Harmonix’s Fantasia, Disco Pixel’s Jungle Rumble, Dejobaan’s Drop That Beat Like an Ugly Baby, and Brace Yourself Games’ Crypt of the NecroDancer for a discussion of the radical bleeding edge of rhythm games. -- Panelists: Trevor Stricker [President, Disco Pixel], Jim Toepel [Senior Designer, Harmonix], Ichiro Lambe [President, Dejobaan], Ryan Clark [Founder, Brace Yourself Games]
Event.name: Break On Through: The Future of Music Games

Event.description: People from every race, religion, gender and sexuality play games. It is in many ways the most universal pastime of human culture, other than eating and sleeping. Why, then, has the culture surrounding video games in particular become so vitriolic? Why is such a beautiful medium marred by hatred? We’ll investigate the possible source of the bile in this panel, but more importantly we’ll talk about how to limit it in your own experiences. It’s not possible to just put your head in the sand and “don’t read the comments” anymore. We can change the discussion. We can do our part to limit anger, resentment, racism, homo- and transphobia, as well as sexism in gaming culture. Here’s how. -- Panelists: Greg Tito [Editor in Chief, The Escapist], Bob Chipman [Video Contributor, The Escapist], Evan Narcisse [Editor, Kotaku], Janelle Bonanno [Editor in Chief, GameFront], Andrew Yoon [Editor in Chief, Shack News], Andrea Rene [Escapist News Now, The Escapist], Andre Meadows [Black Nerd]
Event.name: What You Can Do to End Bile and Hatred in Games Culture

Event.description: After 3 years teaching PAX Prime all that we know about running RPGs, The Art of the Table is finally coming to PAX East! Designed for veteran and novice GMs alike, we’ll focus on what it takes to turn a good RPG into a great one. How are top-notch plots created, what makes for excellent role-playing, and how are vibrant worlds and interesting NPCs created? Join our panel of experts as we search out the secrets of that most elusive of beasts: The Game Master. -- Panelists: Ben Mandall [The Art of the Table], Adam Koebel [Sage Kobold Productions], Mike Mearls [Wizards of the Coast], Randy Scheunemann [Steve Jackson Games], Matt McElroy [DriveThruRPG], Shane LeRose [Veteran GM], Bradford Chatterjee [Scruffy Looking Nerf Herder]
Event.name: The Art of the Table: GMing Beyond the Basics

Event.description: This 1-hour long panel takes a behind-the-scenes look at designing audio for games, exploring the process of creating music and sound with the award-winning composers and sound designers for games like League of Legends, Bioshock Infinite, the Xbox 360 logo, Disney Infinity, Hyper Light Drifter, and The Last Symphony. In addition to showing and discussing examples of their work on these projects, the session will feature an open Q&A. -- Panelists: Duncan Watt [Founder, Fastestmanintheworld Media], Michael Sweet [Artistic Director of Video Game Scoring, Berklee College of Music], Richard Ludlow [Creative Director, Hexany Audio], Richard Gould [Lead Sound Designer, Composer, Hexany Audio], Akash Thakkar [Sound Designer, Composer]
Event.name: Game Audio: From Indie to AAA

Event.description: Chances are you’ve got at least one of those smart phone doohickeys, meaning you know what we mean when we say there are some really incredibly games being developed for the platforms. Many of these have begun to transcend the casual/social stigma, as games for the hardcore start to rival the experiences found on dedicated hardware. Unfortunately while there are all sorts of indie game competitions out there, not many seem to focus specifically on the mobile platforms… and that seemed like a problem we might be able to help with. Join the creators of those games LIVE and on stage! Questions will be asked! Answers may appear!
Event.name: PAX East Indie Showcase

Event.description: 64 Player 1v1, Room B
Event.name: Super Smash Brothers Brawl Tournament - Part 1

Event.description: Get ready to match the stars! Join a hilarious collection of writers, pundits, and comedians for Blankety Blank, the live version of classic TV game show Match Game. Members of the audience will be selected as contestants and challenged to predict how the panelists will answer excessively silly questions. Whoever matches the most answers wins! For a raucous hour of raunchy fun, stop by - and bring your sense of humor. There will be prizes, single entendres, and walks of shame galore. Part of Game Show Night’s third year at PAX East! -- Panelists: Susan Arendt [Managing Editor, Joystiq], Russ Pitts [Features Editor, Polygon], Dan Amrich [Community Developer, Ubisoft], Chris Kohler [Editor, Game|Life], Dale North [Editor in Chief, Destructoid], Richard Mitchell [Review Content Director, Joystiq], Mike Laidlaw [BioWare, Creative Director]
Event.name: Game Show Night: Blankety Blank

Event.description: We all know that gaming can be fun, engaging, and a great way to interact with other people. However, it can be more difficult to assess and understand when gaming takes too great a role in one’s life. How can we tell when too much is too much? What steps can we take to encourage a healthy relationship with gaming? This discussion will explore some of the reasons that gaming can become problematic, how to tell when it’s getting out of hand, and suggest guidelines for making sure that gaming contributes to your life in a beneficial way. -- Panelists: Eric Andrews [Counselor, LCMHC]
Event.name: How Much is Too Much? Finding Balance in Gaming, Pursuits, and Obligations

Event.description: Where are your socks? If you can’t find them it must mean you went to the Friday Night Concerts and had them rocked right off your feet by Bit Brigade, Metroid Metal, and Anamanaguchi! Sorry about that. -- Panelists: Bit Brigade, Metroid Metal, Anamanaguchi
Event.name: Friday Night Concerts

Event.description: 32 Player 1v1, Room A
Event.name: FIFA 14 Tournament

Event.description: From the world’s most viewed, daily, gaming focused news show (on the internet [located within an undisclosed Southern California tri-county area]) ON THE INTERNET, comes for the first time ever, a trio of primarily white people talking about videogames! Join us for a live taping of the hit(?) show IGQA where you can be the star! -- Panelists: **ALL PARTICIPANTS MUST SIGN A WAIVER INDICATING THAT ALL RIGHTS OF MIND, BODY AND SOUL WILL BECOME PROPERTY OF MACHINIMA AND ALL MACHINIMA AFFILIATES IN PERPETUITY. JUST KIDDING, THAT WOULD BE DUMB.**
Event.name: Inside Gaming: Go Deep! (Inside Gaming)

Event.description: An evening of live theater inspired by games like Fallout, Wasteland and Bioshock! “Ray was prepared for the apocalypse, but he wasn’t ready to share his old fallout shelter with his new wife Jane. When nuclear war strikes, they find themselves trapped in a bunker built for one.” After this reading we’ll have a sneak peek at a new play by the same creative team: The Astonishing Adventures of All-American Girl & The Scarlet Skunk. -- Panelists: Charles Battersby [Playwright, Theater For Nerds], Stephanie Willing [Actor/Dancer/Choreographer], Isaiah Tanenbaum [Creative Partner, Flux Theater Company], Victoria Anne Miller [Actress, www.victoriaannemiller.com], Adam Swiderski [Actor], Matthew Trumbull [Actor]
Event.name: That Cute Radioactive Couple: A Post-Apocalyptic Play Reading

Event.description: It can be tough to be positive in the gaming industry. Studio closings, failed games, crunch, and quality of life have become buzzwords for why people leave the game industry. So why does anyone stay? Join a panel of Boston game industry veterans as they talk about how they got past the negativity and continued working in games for a decade - or longer! -- Panelists: Alex Engel [Associate Producer, Disruptor Beam], Alexander Sliwinski [News Content Director, Joystiq], Les Nelken [Lead Designer, WorldTribe Media], Elliott Mitchell [CEO, Vermont Digital Arts]
Event.name: How can we stay positive in the games industry?

Event.description: Pitch your card ideas to the creators of Cards Against Humanity and special guests. The best suggestions will go in the game, the worst suggestions will be mercilessly ridiculed. -- Panelists: Max Temkin [Cards Against Humanity], Trin Garritano [Cards Against Humanity], Claire Friedman [Cards Against Humanity], Emily Haasch [Cards Against Humanity], Jenn Bane [Cards Against Humanity]
Event.name: Cards Against Humanity

Event.description: This…is…Jeopardy! Only all the answers and questions in the PAX Game Show Night edition are geek culture things you know and love—games, sci-fi, memes, games, animation, and games! We’ll take contestants from the audience to play two full games of Jeopardy, just like on the show, complete with lockout buzzers, Daily Doubles, and an affable, blindingly attired host in the person of Dan Amrich! Part of PAX East 2014 Game Show Night. -- Panelists: Dan Amrich [Community Developer, Ubisoft], Katrin Auch [Technician, Game Show Night]
Event.name: Game Show Night: Jeopardy!

Event.description: A Gaming Movie Without the Self Loathing. At PAX Prime in 2010, Critical Threat Theatre premiered a play about friendship, love, loss, and twenty-sided dice called OF DICE AND MEN that was the hit of the con. After a successful Indiegogo campaign and over a year of blood, sweat and gaming - Cavegirl Productions is bringing the feature film version of OF DICE AND MEN back home to PAX! Come join creator Cameron McNary, director Kelley Slagle, and executive producer Seth C. Polansky in a hilarious and touching celebration of everything great about gamer geek culture. www.ofdicemen.com -- Panelists: Cameron McNary [Writer & Co-Star, Of Dice & Men LLC], Seth C. Polansky [Executive Producer, Of Dice & Men LLC], Kelley L. Slagle [Director & Editor, Of Dice & Men LLC], Autumn Moran [Director of Photography, Of Dice & Men LLC]
Event.name: Of Dice & Men - Screening and Q&A with the cast and crew.

Event.description: 64 Player 1v1, Room B
Event.name: Super Smash Brothers Brawl Tournament - Part 2

Event.description: After a drag out fight in 2014 we’re back and more opinionated than ever! You come to us with your one-shot and campaign ideas and we’ll tell you which system you should be running and why. How will you decide which system is Fated to carry your next campaign idea into the Marvelous realm of Godlike gaming experiences? Does your Dungeon need Dragons, Crawling Classics, or Worlds to explore? That’s where we come in. Our team of designers, editors, and nerds will brainstorm, suggest, and debate until you’ve got the system that fits for you. Bring your ideas, we’ll bring the nerd rage. -- Panelists: Brian Liberge [Designer and Creative Director, Beer Star Games], Jim White [Editor/Writer/Designer, T.W.Wombat], Brent P. Newhall [Game Designer, Brent’s Musaeum of Fantastic Wonders], Casey Peavler [Game Designer, DanD Designs], Bob Smith [Game Designer, Freelance], Art Vaccarino [Nerd], Tresi Arvizo [Nerd]
Event.name: Tabletop System Wars II

Event.description: No, it’s not the game they play on Battlestar Galactica, you nerd! It’s the live PAX East version of the classic TV game show, where celebrities play for giant cash prizes! Only except we have no celebrities, and no cash! But other than that, it’s the same exact thing. Pick a category on our pyramid, and our quote-unquote “celebrities” will use clues to try to get you to guess the answers. If you can play Taboo, you can play Pyramid! -- Panelists: Chris Kohler [Editor, WIRED], Regina Wu [Engineer, Intel]
Event.name: Game Show Night: Pyramid!

Event.description: Join IGN editors (and The Escapist’s Andrea) as they discuss the latest and greatest video game news. Get your questions answered about the PS4, Xbox One, and the Gameboy Color. There will be yelling. (It’ll probably be Greg.) -- Panelists: Greg Miller [Host, The Loudmouth, IGN], Daemon Hatfield [Host, The Beauty, IGN], Mitch Dyer [Editor, The Canadian, IGN], Marty Sliva [Editor, The Beard, IGN], Andrea Rene [Host, The Smart One, The Escapist]
Event.name: IGN Game Scoop! Live Podcast
